hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day realized volatility by more than 15 percentage points (indicating compression), and the BTC price is trading within +/-2% of its 20-day moving average in a NEUTRAL regime, the subsequent 5-day absolute return will exceed the 5-day implied volatility priced into BTC options by at least 5 percentage points.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. Options markets may underpricе realized volatility expansion when compression is extreme, creating a long volatility edge. The SMA filter ensures we enter during consolidation, not a trend.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5 days after entry, or when |5-day return| > |5-day ATM IV| + 0.05
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes >3% below 20D_SMA after entry (failed breakout)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of signals result in 5-day absolute returns that are LESS than the 5-day implied volatility minus 2 percentage points.
